business.headline: Your health insurance premiums might go up if you live in these citiesWhile higher premiums may sound like an unfair penalty for metro city dwellers, experts say it reflects the growing health and cost gap between metros and smaller towns due to numerous factors.

US, EU trade talks still on; atmanirbharta is resilient interdependence: SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday said efforts to finalise trade agreements with the US and the EU are in "full force."

Physicswallah IPO opens on November 11: Check price, size, GMP and key detailsThe wait is nearly over for investors tracking PhysicsWallah. The edtech firm will open its IPO on November 11, aiming to raise significant capital as it prepares for its stock market debut. Here's everything you need to know in simple terms.

Sensex, Nifty erase early gains to close lower, FII selling dampens marketThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 148.14 points to close at 83,311.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 87.95 points to end at 25,509.70.

Pine Labs IPO opens tomorrow for bidding: Check price band, GMP, other detailsPine Labs IPO involves the sale of 9.41 crore new shares aggregating to Rs 2,080 crore, while the offer for sale includes 8.23 crore shares worth Rs 1,819.91 crore, being sold by existing shareholders.

Shiv Nadar tops Hurun Philanthropy List 2025. Here's who else made the top 10Shiv Nadar and family have retained the top spot for the fourth time in five years. The HCL founder donated Rs 2,708 crore in 2025, averaging Rs 7.4 crore per day, up 26% from last year.

Is BPNL a lifesaver or a debt trap? The hidden side of easy credit, explains expertBuy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) has made shopping feel easier than ever — no paperwork, no waiting, just buy now and pay in instalments. But beneath the convenience lies a growing concern: is it really a smart money tool or a slippery debt trap? Let's have a look.

Reliance moves to sell Middle East crude as sanctions reshape trade: ReportThe company has reportedly offered grades such as Murban and Upper Zakum to both domestic and overseas buyers in recent days. While it is not yet clear how much crude Reliance is seeking to offload, the approach itself has caught the oil market's attention.

From ICICI, HDFC to SBI: Personal loan interest rates across 7 top banksIf you're planning to take a personal loan, comparing interest rates can save you a lot of money. Here's a quick look at what seven major banks, including SBI, ICICI, HDFC and Canara, are currently charging.

ED summons Anil Ambani for second time on November 14 in loan fraud caseHe was earlier summoned and interrogated by the ED in August 2025 as part of the ongoing probe into alleged financial irregularities involving loans taken by his group companies from Indian banks, including the State Bank of India (SBI).

Gold, silver prices are rising again. Is there more upside left?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), December gold futures hovered around Rs 1.20 lakh per 10 grams through the morning session, rebounding slightly from levels seen earlier this week. Silver saw a bigger gain after recent weakness and was trading at around Rs 1.47 lakh per kg.

Bihar Elections 2025: Who are the richest politicians contesting this time?Bihar, often seen as a political pulse point for national trends, is set for a two-phase election that will decide the leadership of a state rich in history and political influence.

Pension rules clarified: How does your last working day impact benefits?Under the Central Civil Services (Pension) Rules, 2021, an employee's pension will now be calculated based on the rules that are active on their final day of service. This could be the day they retire, resign, are discharged from duty, or pass away — whichever happens first.

Anil Ambani's Reliance Group faces government probe. What we know so farThe probe escalation follows aggressive enforcement actions by the ED. In the past week, the ED attached assets worth nearly Rs 7,500 crore in connection with alleged fund diversion.
M&M exits RBL Bank with stake sale worth Rs 6,780 croreM&M had acquired the stake in 2023 when the private sector lender was going through a period of regulatory scrutiny and leadership changes.

Paytm shares jump 4% despite Q2 profit slip. Here's whyPaytm's profit fell, but stronger operations and MSCI inflows kept investors optimistic. The coming quarters will show if this momentum can last.
Sensex opens 280 points higher, Nifty above 25,600; Asian Paints up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 202.50 points to 83,661.65, while the NSE Nifty50 added 27.55 points to 25,625.20 as of 9:31 am.

Should Sebi step in if IPO valuations are inflated?Experts say that while robust demand in IPOs reflects the growing maturity of India's equity market, the pattern of high valuations and subsequent weak listings suggests a need for more scrutiny.

Lenskart IPO allotment today: Here's how to check status and GMP before listingInvestors who applied for the Lenskart IPO can check their allotment status using either the BSE website or the registrar's porta,  MUFG Intime India Private Limited (formerly Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).
More trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group as government launches probeMore trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, Corporate Affairs ministry launches probe into fund diversion

entertainment.headline: Mahhi Vij hospitalised amid divorce rumours, her team shares health update Television actor Mahhi Vij has been hospitalised due to a high fever and extreme weakness, her publicist confirmed. This development comes amid ongoing reports of her rumoured separation from husband Jay Bhanushali.

Tamil actor Gouri Kishan blasts reporter's body-shaming question: You're a disgrace Actor Gouri Kishan responded strongly to a journalist's question about her weight at a Chennai press event for her film, sparking widespread online debate and support for her stance against objectification and body-shaming.

Timothee Chalamet dodges questions on Kylie Jenner romance, stays private Timothée Chalamet declined to discuss his relationship with Kylie Jenner in a recent interview, emphasising personal privacy while reflecting on family values and his work-life balance.

The great OTT shift: Is India's love story with theatres on the wane? Once the heart of every Friday, the theatre experience now struggles to compete with the comfort of home screens. Rising costs, shorter attention spans, and the OTT boom have changed how India watches movies today.

Tom Cruise cheers Glen Powell at The Running Man screening: You crushed it Tom Cruise attended the screening of Glen Powell's new film 'The Running Man'. The film is scheduled for release in theaters on November 14.

The Testament of Ann Lee teaser: Amanda Seyfried captivates as a spiritual leader The teaser for Mona Fastvold's musical drama 'The Testament of Ann Lee', starring Amanda Seyfried, is out. The actor is seen playing the Shaker movement's founder.

Stranger Things Tales From '85: Netflix revives Hawkins in animated form Netflix offers a first glimpse at the animated series 'Stranger Things: Tales From '85', set between seasons two and three, along with a new voice cast for the beloved Hawkins characters.

Bigg Boss 19 Day 74: Amaal becomes new captain, Gaurav slams Farrhana The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' was marked by intense confrontations, particularly between Gaurav Khanna and Farrhana Bhatt. Amaal Mallik ultimately secured the captaincy.

Singer and former actor Sulakshana Pandit dies at 68 Sulakshana Pandit, known for her roles in the 1970s Indian cinema and her prolific singing career, died on Thursday at the age of 68. Her brother, music composer Lalit Pandit, confirmed the news of her death.

Michael to release in April 2026, Jaafar Jackson plays King of Pop. Watch trailer The trailer for the much-anticipated biopic 'Michael' is finally out. Starring Jaafar Jackson, the biopic will offer audiences a cinematic glimpse into the life of the King of Pop.

The Punch of Shiva documentary: Chiranjeevi, Prabhas, Rajamouli on RGV classic  As Telugu cinema's landmark film 'Shiva' gears up for its grand 4K Dolby Atmos re-release on November 14 2025, the makers have unveiled a special documentary titled 'The Punch of Shiva'.

Karan Johar admits feeling lonely at National Awards: Had no 'plus one' Filmmaker Karan Johar opened up about feeling lonely during significant career achievements, including his recent National Award win. The revelation came during his conversation with former Tennis player Sania Mirza on her podcast.

Aryan Khan to direct Shah Rukh Khan in 2027: Report The third project of Aryan Khan could reportedly feature Shah Rukh Khan in the lead role. The anticipated collaboration is expected to take shape in 2027, following the completion of Aryan's next film.

Emraan Hashmi: The Ba***ds of Bollywood would earn Rs 700 crore in theatres Actor Emraan Hashmi applauded Aryan Khan's daring Netflix series - 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' for its unique style. He said that the series could have been a major theatrical success and hopes to work with Shah Rukh Khan soon.

Aaromaley review: Refreshingly honest rom-com with heart and humourRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025 Aaromaley movie review: Director Sarang Thiagu's 'Aaromaley', starring Kishen Das, Shivathmika and Harshath Khan, is a warm and fuzzy romantic entertainer that is all heart. Strong characterisations and realistic conversations make us look past minor shortcomings.

Shiamak Davar to choreograph Ranbir Kapoor in Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana. Details Choreographer Shiamak Davar has joined Nitesh Tiwari's ambitious two-part Ramayana, featuring Ranbir Kapoor, Sai Pallavi, and Yash. He expressed enthusiasm about working on the mythological epic in a recent interview.

Nuremberg review: Russell Crowe shines in courtroom epic that lacks emotional depthRelease Date:Sat Nov 01, 2025 'Nuremberg' is technically superb, showcasing the moral weight of history, but the drama rarely moves beyond the obvious. Though Russell Crowe gives a commanding performance, the film ultimately feels too safe, lacking the psychological crackle and moral reckoning it deserves.

Actor Lee Si Young gives birth to second child via IVF, calls baby God's gift Actor Lee Si Young has announced the birth of her second child, a daughter, one day after giving birth. The actor used her Instagram account to share photos and a message expressing her gratitude and reflecting on her journey, which included IVF and navigating major life changes after her divorce earlier this year.

I Am Not An Actor director on film's message: Accept people as they are Director Aditya Kripalani shared that his film 'I Am Not An Actor' highlights the need for human connection. The story explores loneliness and mental health through a retired banker's online connection with a struggling actor.

general news.headline: Trump plans to visit India next year, says trade talks with PM Modi going wellThe US President said he would visit India next year and praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for scaling back oil imports from Russia amid ongoing trade negotiations.

Delhi wakes up to thick haze as air quality slips back to very poorThe capital's air quality deteriorated again on Friday, with ITO and Narela recording AQI levels above 330. Officials have blamed the spike on falling temperatures and rising farm fires.

Video: Bihar Deputy CM, RJD leader trade barbs of being drunk in heated spatA day of polling in Bihar's Lakhisarai turned volatile as Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha and RJD MLC Ajay Kumar engaged in a heated on-camera altercation, trading accusations of drunken misconduct and voter bribery.

Lip reader reveals Erika Kirk's emotional exchange with JD Vance during viral hugSince her husband's killing, Erika has faced relentless public scrutiny -- including criticism for returning to work too soon after his death. Introducing Vance at a packed Turning Point USA event, Erika described the vice president as a "very, very dear friend".

When Pakistan slaughtered Frontier Gandhi's 600 unarmed PathansOn August 12, 1948, the Babrra village in the Pathan-dominated Charsadda of the North-West Frontier Province (NWFP), was drenched in the blood of hundreds of unarmed Khudai Khidmatgars. They were followers of Frontier Gandhi, Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan, and peacefully demanding their rights. The Pakistani state, led by Muhammad Ali Jinnah, opened fire without mercy. This massacre, referred to as the "Karbala of the Pashtuns", is one of the darkest stains on Pakistan's early history.

Watch: Elon Musk dances with robot as Tesla approves his $1 trillion pay packageTesla shareholders approved a landmark pay package worth up to $1 trillion for Elon Musk, after an exuberant Austin meeting featuring dancing robots, bold growth targets, and Musk's trademark showmanship.

Hold love, respect for PM Modi: Chirag Paswan says can't part ways with BJPChirag Paswan reaffirmed his unwavering loyalty to PM Modi, saying the Prime Minister is the only person he loves and respects after his parents, and he can never part ways with the BJP.

Cultural fascism: Protests in Dhaka as Yunus govt bows to Islamists on musicTeachers and students of Dhaka University and Jagannath University protested against the Yunus administration's decision to junk posts of music and physical education teachers in public schools. The decision to drop the posts followed fierce pushback from several Islamist organisations who called the move "un-Islamic".

Video: Pharma executive collapses behind Trump during drug price announcementThe event, which featured top pharmaceutical executives and administration officials, was intended to spotlight the administration's new Most Favored Nations drug pricing initiative, a plan to make GLP-1 medications more affordable for millions of Americans.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Mamdani, Adani, Ambani. The linkThough New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani champions socialist politics in New York, his surname traces back to the same Gujarati roots as that of corporates Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani. Across the seas and centuries, these family names tell a story of commerce, migration and shared histories.

Armless archer Sheetal Devi scripts history, picked in India's able-bodied teamWorld champion para archer Sheetal Devi made history by earning selection to India's able-bodied junior archery team. The armless archer made the cut after finishing third at the national trials.

At 64.66%, Bihar phase 1 polling witnesses highest-ever voter turnoutBihar election 2025: Bihar's phase 1 elections saw a historic voter turnout of 64.66%, the highest ever in the state's history. In 2020, the Mahagathbandhan, led by the RJD, had the upper hand in these constituencies.

Singer and former actor Sulakshana Pandit dies at 68Sulakshana Pandit, known for her roles in the 1970s Indian cinema and her prolific singing career, died on Thursday at the age of 68. Her brother, music composer Lalit Pandit, confirmed the news of her death.

Delhi's high AQI smog can feel like a mild concussion, says top neurologistDelhi's air pollution can cause brain effects similar to a mild concussion. Beyond the lungs, the neurological impact of toxic air heavy with PM 2.5 particles is worrying.

Couples are using the bird theory to test their love, but should you?Another day, another social media trend. This time, couples are testing their love with the bird theory. But should a trend really define your relationship?

Muslims can't recite it: Abu Azmi declines BJP MLA's Vande Mataram recitation offerAmeet Satam had invited Abu Azmi to the event, scheduled for Friday morning near the SP leader's residence in Mumbai, as part of the Maharashtra government's week-long celebrations marking 150 years of Vande Mataram.

State-sponsored bribery: Prashant Kishor slams NDA's Rs 10,000 scheme for womenIn an interview with India Today Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai on the day of the first phase of polling, Prashant Kishor said the government's cash transfers were being distributed even after the model code of conduct had come into effect.

Not a Mathematician, but she solved a problem experts couldn't for 60 YearsMarjorie Rice, a homemaker from San Diego, solved a decades-old geometry problem. Her discovery of new pentagon tilings challenged the notion that only experts can make major mathematical breakthroughs.

The great OTT shift: Is India's love story with theatres on the wane?Once the heart of every Friday, the theatre experience now struggles to compete with the comfort of home screens. Rising costs, shorter attention spans, and the OTT boom have changed how India watches movies today.

Russia accuses Pakistani paper of serving 'foreign sponsors' in anti-Russia pushCountering the newspaper's portrayal of Russia as "economically weak" and "vulnerable to sanctions," the embassy said such claims were baseless and reflective of "mindless copying of Western talking points".

At least 5 killed as Afghanistan and Pak exchange fire amid peace talks in IstanbulAfghan Taliban and Pakistani troops exchanged brief gunfire along the border, each blaming the other for the flare-up. The clash occurred just as peace talks began to create a lasting framework to avoid future confrontations.

Retired bureaucrat occupies 'vacant' post in Mumbai civic body, officers opposeA group of 16 Deputy Municipal Commissioners in Mumbai has objected to a retired bureaucrat holding an important civic post, raising concerns over missed promotion opportunities for serving officers. The protest highlights ongoing tensions within the municipal administration regarding staffing and transparency.

Tamil actor Gouri Kishan blasts reporter's body-shaming question: You're a disgraceActor Gouri Kishan responded strongly to a journalist's question about her weight at a Chennai press event for her film, sparking widespread online debate and support for her stance against objectification and body-shaming.

Timothee Chalamet dodges questions on Kylie Jenner romance, stays privateTimothée Chalamet declined to discuss his relationship with Kylie Jenner in a recent interview, emphasising personal privacy while reflecting on family values and his work-life balance.

sports.headline: Asia Cup trophy yet to return home, but India ready for another Asia Cup It's been over a month since India defeated Pakistan in the Asia Cup T20 final, yet the trophy has still not reached Indian hands. With no presentation or closure, the triumph feels oddly unfinished. Now, as the BCCI confirms participation in the Rising Star Asia Cup, another chapter begins. The familiar rivalry is set to resume, but questions over the ACC's governance continue to linger.

Bengaluru snubbed again, Ahmedabad set to host T20 World Cup final: Report Bengaluru is unlikely to host matches in the T20 World Cup 2026. According to a PTI report, the city has been snubbed once again due in the aftermath of the 2025 stampede incident which claimed the life of 11 people.

Why Dhoni-esque Dhruv Jurel deserves spot in Test team alongside Rishabh Pant Dhruv Jurel once again showcased his composure under pressure with a measured knock against South Africa A in the second unofficial Test. But with Rishabh Pant set to return for the South Africa series, the key question remains — can Jurel retain his place as a specialist batter alongside the Indian vice-captain?

You need Gill in T20I side: Ex-cricketers slam India vice-captain's critics Former India cricketers Varun Aaron and Irfan Pathan rallied behind Shubman Gill after his composed innings in the fourth T20I against Australia. Gill's 46-run knock, though restrained, proved instrumental in guiding India to victory.

Vidit Gujrathi downs Argentine prodigy, Pranav and Pranesh win in 3rd round Vidit Gujrathi held his nerve to outplay 12-year-old sensation Faustino Oro in the rapid tiebreaks, while Pranav V and Pranesh M also secured clutch wins to extend India's strong run at the FIDE World Cup 2025. The Indian contingent now features seven players in Round 3.

Quinton de Kock's first hundred after return blows away Pakistan in 2nd ODI Quinton de Kock's unbeaten 123 powered South Africa to a comprehensive victory in the second ODI against Pakistan, levelling the three-match series 1-1. De Kock's hundred anchored a dominant chase of 270, with support from Tony de Zorzi and strong bowling performances from Nandre Burger and Nqaba Peter.

Steve Waugh ends the debate, calls Virat Kohli greatest ODI player of all time Legendary Australia captain has named Virat Kohli as the best ODI cricketer in history. Kohli is the second-highest run scorer in the 50-over format with 14,255 runs, including a record 51 centuries.

Cristiano Ronaldo reveals why he did not attend Diogo Jota's funeral Cristiano Ronaldo explains why he chose not to attend Diogo Jota's funeral, saying his presence would have shifted attention away from the grieving family during an emotional time.

Winning the World Cup was destiny, God had already written this: Deepti Sharma All-rounder Deepti Sharma reflected on the team's Women's World Cup 2025 triumph and said the win was written in destiny and God had already planned it.

PM Modi noticing my lord Hanuman tattoo and Insta bio meant a lot: Deepti Sharma India all-rounder Deepti Sharma shares her excitement after meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The PM acknowledged her Lord Hanuman tattoo and Instagram bio, highlighting her unique connection with the leader.

I was trying to improve my bowling, it was not happening: Shivam Dube Australia vs India, 4th T20I: Shivam Dube credited Gautam Gambhir, Suryakumar Yadav and Morne Morkel for helping him improve his bowling skills. Dube took two crucial wickets in India's 48-run win in Gold Coast on Thursday, November 6.

Steve Waugh ends the debate, calls Virat Kohli greatest ODI player of all time Legendary Australia captain has named Virat Kohli as the best ODI cricketer in history. Kohli is the second-highest run scorer in the 50-over format with 14,255 runs, including a record 51 centuries.

Dube took two crucial wickets in India's 48-run win in Gold Coast on Thursday, November 6.

Bindaas bowling daal: Shivam Dube enjoys Gautam Gambhir's trust in secondary skillAUS vs IND, 2nd T20I: Once seen as only a middle-order hitter, Shivam Dube is finally earning the trust he waited years for with the ball. Backed by Gautam Gambhir, guided by Morne Morkel and captained by Suryakumar Yadav, Dube is getting opportunities to bowl under pressure and test himself.

Armless archer Sheetal Devi scripts history, picked in India's able-bodied teamWorld champion para archer Sheetal Devi made history by earning selection to India's able-bodied junior archery team. The armless archer made the cut after finishing third at the national trials.

IND A vs SA A: Jurel makes big statement before South Africa series with 132India A recovered from a severe top-order collapse to post 255 all out against South Africa A, thanks to a composed, unbeaten 132 from Dhruv Jurel. Kuldeep Yadav added valuable support with a gritty 20 as the pair rebuilt the innings after the team slumped to 126 for 7.

WPL 2026: Full list of players retained and released by all five teamsThe field is set as the five franchises have retained their players ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League 2026 auction. There were some big and bold calls by all five teams as they revealed the retentions and releases before the new season.

UP Warriorz explain surprising releases of Deepti Sharma, Alyssa HealyWPL 2026: UP Warriorz released most of their star players, including Deepti Sharma ahead of the Women's Premier League mega auction. The franchise aims for a fresh start with a clean slate and the biggest auction purse for the 2026 season.

Did Pratika receive Women's World Cup winner's medal after ICC rule change?Pratika Rawal, initially denied a medal due to ICC rules despite her significant role in India's Women's World Cup victory, was later seen wearing the medal in a photo with President Draupadi Murmu. Rawal was India's second-highest run scorer of the tournament with 308 runs from six innings.

After World Cup win, Harmanpreet sacrifices Rs 1 crore, slips to MI's 2nd retentionMumbai Indians opted to make a rather interesting call by retaining the captain, Harmanpreet Kaur as their second-choice pick at Rs 2.5 crore and giving the top spot to the England all-rounder, Nat Sciver-Brunt.

Axar Patel credits slow pitch, unexpected bounce for match-winning spellIndia all-rounder Axar Patel credited the slow surface and unexpected bounce at the Carrara Oval following his match-winning all-round show in the fourth T20I against Australia.

UP Warriorz explain surprising releases of Deepti Sharma, Alyssa HealyWPL 2026: UP Warriorz released most of their star players, including Deepti Sharma ahead of the Women's Premier League mega auction. The franchise aims for a fresh start with a clean slate and the biggest auction purse for the 2026 season.

Did Pratika receive Women's World Cup winner's medal after ICC rule change?Pratika Rawal, initially denied a medal due to ICC rules despite her significant role in India's Women's World Cup victory, was later seen wearing the medal in a photo with President Draupadi Murmu. Rawal was India's second-highest run scorer of the tournament with 308 runs from six innings.

After World Cup win, Harmanpreet sacrifices Rs 1 crore, slips to MI's 2nd retentionMumbai Indians opted to make a rather interesting call by retaining the captain, Harmanpreet Kaur as their second-choice pick at Rs 2.5 crore and giving the top spot to the England all-rounder, Nat Sciver-Brunt.

Axar Patel credits slow pitch, unexpected bounce for match-winning spellIndia all-rounder Axar Patel credited the slow surface and unexpected bounce at the Carrara Oval following his match-winning all-round show in the fourth T20I against Australia.

WPL retentions: Deepti Sharma, Sree Charani among big India World Cup stars releasedWomen's World Cup 2025 Player Of The Tournament Deepti Sharma and Sree Charani were among the big names released by their respective franchises during the WPL 2026 retentions. The likes of Renuka Thakur and Kranti Goud will also be looking for new teams.

India trade flair for precision to skittle Australia in tacky Gold CoastAustralia (AUS) vs India (IND), 4th T20I: India did not need a flamboyant show on a sluggish pitch that resembled home in Gold Coast on Thursday. Riding on a solid batting show and a disciplined bowling performance, India sealed a 48-run win.

Watch: Sunil Chhetri hands Indian passport to ex-Aussie star in historic momentRyan Williams officially became an Indian citizen, receiving his passport from Sunil Chhetri in a fun ceremony. His inclusion marks a historic first step in AIFF's effort to bring OCI players into Indian football.

Chapman stars as New Zealand survive West Indies onslaught for 2nd T20I winA late fightback from Rovman Powell and the West Indies lower order was not enough as Kyle Jamieson defended seven runs in the final four balls, handing New Zealand a three-run victory and levelling the T20I series. Mark Chapman was the star of the show with the bat for the Blackcaps in the first innings.

PM Modi serves food to wheelchair-bound Pratika Rawal at champions' meet in DelhiPrime Minister Narendra Modi was seen serving food to Pratika Rawal, who was on a wheelchair during the felicitation ceremony for Women's World Cup winners in New Delhi on Wednesday.

Azam Khan agrees with Suryakumar Yadav's no rivalry claim for India and PakistanAzam Khan agrees with Suryakumar Yadav's statement that India and Pakistan no longer share a cricket rivalry. The India skipper had made the massive claim during the Asia Cup 2025.

Gukesh and Arjun Erigaisi advance on day of major upsetsThe Chess World Cup saw some dominant performances from the likes of Arjun Erigaisi, Gukesh, as well as other strong contenders in Vincent Keymer and Anish Giri, but there were some major upsets in the form of Ian Nepomniachthchi and Wesley So getting eliminated.

Why is Ruturaj Gaikwad not in T20I scene? Ashwin questions Indian team managementR Ashwin has asked why Ruturaj Gaikwad isn't in the T20I scene for India after being a consistent performer in the IPL. Ruturaj last played for India during the Zimbabwe tour right after the T20 World Cup 2024 win.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
